reviews.review_msg: She really enjoys teaching this course therefore her positive attitude and detailed knowledge of the course content makes the lectures a great experience. Sadly the course was at night time so we ended class early a few times. She gives great feed back and is more than willing to go over content you don't understand.

Fantastic prof! Loved her class, she is engaging, knows the material inside and out, and is very good about responding to student questions. She was available for extra help, gave useful feedback on drafts to our papers, and was a very fair marker. Definitely going to take another class of hers if I can.
If you're looking for an easy course, this probably isn't it.  She's a really good lecturer.

If u are not interested in philosophy, nothing is going to be fun in this class. But the only good thing is that she is predicable in the terms of her marking and her essay questions even though she does mark hard. The overheads aren't bad, and as long as you do the readings before class it isn't too bad and you should be able to follow along.

She's is a nice professor, tries to get the class going but only those who actually get it or those who speak up more often will participate. Notes are in overhead format and are very unorganized. Often goes off topic, analogies and examples are difficult to comprehend.  Textbook is expensive, heavy and barely used. Worst of all it was at night,ZZZ

To previous poster: I'm a girl and I certainly did not get an A on the midterm though I'm in my 4rth year and usually do get A's. So your sexism theory can't be totally correct. Furthermore, for the essays she will mark them blind--she asks us not to put our name on them to ensure a lack of bias. I love this, because mostly profs let bias reign.
This is a really enjoyable course.
